subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: What Is Hinduism? The Oldest Religion
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Is Hinduism? The Oldest Religion usable.

hook.text: Hinduism has no founder, no single scripture, and no single god. It's the world's oldest religion â€” over 4,000 years.

buildup.text: It emerged gradually in the Indus Valley. The Vedas, its oldest texts, date to around 1500 BCE.

discovery.text: Hinduism is more a family of traditions than one religion. It embraces many gods, philosophies, and practices.

twist.text: This flexibility is its strength. Unlike other faiths, there's no single 'right' way to be Hindu.

climax.text: With 1.2 billion followers, Hinduism thrives precisely because it bends. Rigidity breaks; flexibility endures.

punchline.text: No founder, no single god, 4,000 years old. Hinduism endures by bending.

quiz.question: What makes Hinduism unique among major religions?
options: It has no single founder or scripture
